name: Potassium Chloride
indications: potassium chloride extended-release indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .
contraindications: monitor serum potassium adjust dosages accordingly . ( 2.1 ) serum potassium less 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation . ( 2.1 ) take meals glass water liquid . swallow tablets whole without crushing , chewing sucking . ( 2.1 ) treatment hypokalemia : doses range 40 100 meq/day divided doses . limit doses 40 meq per dose . ( 2.2 ) prevention hypokalemia : typical dose 20 meq per day . ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride extended-release tablets , usp contains 750 mg potassium chloride ( equivalent 10 meq potassium respectively ) . ndc : 70518-2313-00 ndc : 70518-2313-01 ndc : 70518-2313-02 packaging : 30 1 blister pack packaging : 90 1 bottle plastic packaging : 30 1 bottle plastic store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight container child-resistant closure . keep tightly closed . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients triamterene amiloride .
indications_original: Potassium chloride extended-release is indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original: Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosages accordingly. ( 2.1 ) If serum potassium is less than 2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation. ( 2.1 ) Take with meals and with a glass of water or other liquid. Swallow tablets whole without crushing, chewing or sucking. ( 2.1 ) Treatment of hypokalemia: Doses range from 40 to 100 mEq/day in divided doses. Limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. ( 2.2 ) Prevention of hypokalemia: Typical dose is 20 mEq per day. ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium chloride extended-release tablets, USP contains 750 mg of potassium chloride (equivalent to 10 mEq of potassium respectively).
                  NDC: 70518-2313-00
                  NDC: 70518-2313-01
                  NDC: 70518-2313-02
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Dispense in a tight container with a child-resistant closure.
                  Keep tightly closed.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on triamterene and amiloride.
